snippet: As China’s policy makers gather in Beijing this week to discuss how to overhaul the economy, signs abound that the service sector is playing an increasingly important role.
abstract: China's services sector, which has been growing steadily, is playing more important role as nation's policy makers gather in Beijing to discuss how to overhaul the economy; at 45 percent, activity now accounts for roughly as large a percentage of economy as manufacturing sector

byline.contributor: Lucy Chen contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: As China’s policy makers gather in Beijing this week to discuss how to overhaul the economy, signs abound that the service sector is playing an increasingly important role.

headline.main: Service Sector Gaining Steam in Chinese Economy
headline.print_headline: Service Sector Gaining Steam in Chinese Economy
